title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CLEVELAND — On a night where the rim must have looked as wide as the ocean, Darrell Armstrong didn’t just win a game; he authored a legendary performance that defied logic and carried his team to an improbable victory. The Orlando Magic guard came off the bench to detonate for a career-high 46 points, single-handedly outscoring the entire Cavaliers starting lineup and powering the Magic to a gritty 86-82 road win in 1997.

On a night when the rest of the Magic’s offense sputtered, Armstrong was a supernova. He was relentless, attacking the basket and sinking shots from all over the floor, accounting for over half of his team’s total points. His 46-point outburst was a stunning display of individual brilliance, a scoring barrage so potent it rendered every other matchup on the floor a secondary concern. The Cavaliers, led by a strong 21-point, 11-rebound double-double from Shawn Kemp, simply had no answer for the historic onslaught.

The Cavaliers’ defense, which held the rest of the Magic in check, could only watch as Armstrong put on a masterclass. Every time Cleveland threatened to close the gap, Armstrong had an answer, a dagger shot that silenced the home crowd and extinguished any hope of a comeback.

This was more than a win; it was the Darrell Armstrong Game. A night where one man’s transcendent effort etched his name into the annals of NBA lore, proving that on any given night, a single player can become an unstoppable force and rewrite the script all by himself.
